title: The Chair - PP501 Black/Ash
body: Guided by the principle of a chair with no backside and beautiful from all angles, Hans J. Wegner was able to produce at least 500 chairs in all of his lifetime. But amongst all of that, the Round Chair or “The Chair” is the most internationally recognized design. Featuring a back and an armrest made of continuous wooden semi-circle, it was acclaimed as the most beautiful chair in the world in the cover of an American Magazine in 1950. The chair that became the cornerstone of many array of designs, this is absolutely the most important work of Hans J. Wegner.
